page.title: 08RUMMERS FARM
page.content: RUMMERS FARM-J.A.CLARKE The Clarke family moved to Inham Hall in October 1917 and farmed Rummers Farm. At this time there were 256 acres which has now, in 1985, increased to approximately 600 acres. In the 1920's twelve men were employed mainly on fruit, potatoes, flowers and wheat. In 1985 the farm employs eight men working on a variety of crops such as potatoes, sugarbeet, peas,rape seed, onions, barley and wheat.The wages of the twelve workers totalled Â£20 per week in 1920, by 1985 one worker earns four times that amount. Machinery such as tractors were first used on the farm in 1934, before that most of the heavy work was done by horses. The cost of produce has increased greatly. In 1920 potatoes were Â£5-Â£7 per ton and in 1985 Â£250 per ton.
